intro: Carex siderosticta var. ciliatomarginata, commonly known as the silver-haired sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants commonly found in moist or wetland environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves with a distinctive silvery sheen along the margins, giving it its common name. It typically grows in shallow water or damp soils, often in marshes or along stream banks. Its inflorescence consists of a dense, cylindrical spike that bears small, inconspicuous flowers.
